:::{.def}

This section covers indexing from the various data structures.

:::

## Indexing atomic vectors

:::{.example}

Here is an example with an atomic vector of size one:

:::

Indexing in R starts at `1` and is done with square brackets next to the element to index:


::: {.cell hash='indexing_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_10a2d1a6fcc674a164feb5abd3910c86'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x <- 2
x
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 2
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
x[1]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 2
```
:::
:::


What happens if we index out of range?


::: {.cell hash='indexing_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_9d0e7162b7c61696f68a06408d1a1805'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x[2]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] NA
```
:::
:::


:::{.example}

Example for an atomic vector with multiple elements:

:::


::: {.cell hash='indexing_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_635dac00a6db048e837c232bef669d9d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x <- c(2, 4, 1)
x
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 2 4 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
x[2]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 4
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
x[2:4]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1]  4  1 NA
```
:::
:::


## Indexing matrices and arrays


::: {.cell hash='indexing_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_cb7a1e061d2b1cdabc2dfc164fb4381e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x <- matrix(1:12, nrow = 3, ncol = 4)
x
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
     [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
[1,]    1    4    7   10
[2,]    2    5    8   11
[3,]    3    6    9   12
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
x[2, 3]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 8
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
x <- array(as.double(1:24), c(3, 2, 4))
x
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
, , 1

     [,1] [,2]
[1,]    1    4
[2,]    2    5
[3,]    3    6

, , 2

     [,1] [,2]
[1,]    7   10
[2,]    8   11
[3,]    9   12

, , 3

     [,1] [,2]
[1,]   13   16
[2,]   14   17
[3,]   15   18

, , 4

     [,1] [,2]
[1,]   19   22
[2,]   20   23
[3,]   21   24
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
x[2, 1, 3]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 14
```
:::
:::


## Indexing lists


::: {.cell hash='indexing_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_38335421438110341dbc17c0c6ea896b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x <- list(2L, 3:8, c(2, 1), FALSE, "string")
x
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[[1]]
[1] 2

[[2]]
[1] 3 4 5 6 7 8

[[3]]
[1] 2 1

[[4]]
[1] FALSE

[[5]]
[1] "string"
```
:::
:::


Indexing a list returns a list:


::: {.cell hash='indexing_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_784df8788e061db8d6fb07fa6e81705f'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x[3]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[[1]]
[1] 2 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
typeof(x[3])
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "list"
```
:::
:::


To extract elements of a list, double square brackets are required:


::: {.cell hash='indexing_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_b30e387cd1fa525c8be33379a13b4668'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x[[3]]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 2 1 8
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
typeof(x[[3]])
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "double"
```
:::
:::

## Indexing data frames


::: {.cell hash='indexing_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_2f403fb0b55c99230fea1a5904a4a1c2'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x <- data.frame(
  country = c("Canada", "USA", "Mexico"),
  var = c(2.9, 3.1, 4.5)
)
x
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  country var
1  Canada 2.9
2     USA 3.1
3  Mexico 4.5
```
:::
:::


A data frame is a list of atomic vectors representing the various columns:


::: {.cell hash='indexing_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_5bb15e3a6442fafded38cc4de8f5cd6e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x[1]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  country
1  Canada
2     USA
3  Mexico
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
typeof(x[1])
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "list"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
x[[1]]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "Canada" "USA"    "Mexico"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
typeof(x[[1]])
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "character"
```
:::
:::


Indexing dataframes can also be done using the column names:


::: {.cell hash='indexing_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_b80ff534e624f12bfaaac29dc719ee73'}

```{.r .cell-code}
x$country
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "Canada" "USA"    "Mexico"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
identical(x[[1]], x$country)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] TRUE
```
:::
:::
